title: Lisa Faulkner stuns in black sequin gown and 'bride' hat night before her wedding

Lisa Faulkner looked outstanding in a sequin embellished gown and "hat that keeps on giving" the night before she married John Torode.

The celebrity chef, 47, was glam from head to toe as she stepped out for family celebrations on Wednesday night before giving herself away to the "man of my dreams".

In an Instagram photo giving details of her night, Lisa wore a tight-fitted black sequin gown with a slight leg split, and peep toe black heels.

She paired the elegant outfit with a dusky pink crown-shaped embellished hat with the word "bride" embroidered in gold, which she named "the hat that keeps on giving!!".

The Holby City star then went on to say: "The night before the wedding...

"We had such a lovely dinner with all the fam and our nearest and dearest @aynhoepark. Can't stop smiling."

(Image: lisafaulknercooks/Instagram)

Lisa and John spent their wedding eve with family at Aynhoe Park, which was privately hired - and was the same venue they held the wedding ceremony the following day.

It's a Grade I listed 17th-century country house rebuilt after the English Civil War, and offers a bespoke wedding service.

As for the wedding, Lisa was a vision in a stunning wedding gown.

(Image: lisafaulknercooks/Instagram)

The couple exchanged their vows at the glamorous setting on Thursday in front of family and friends.

Blushing bride Lisa was gorgeous in a white wedding dress with a very demure lace neckline and cinched waistline to frame her figure perfectly.

(Image: aynhoepark/Instagram)

(Image: aynhoepark/Instagram)

The Holby City actress carried a bouquet made up of roses, floral sprigs and greenery. John styled out a button hole to match her floral arrangement.

The happy couple later took some photobooth snaps and each posed in a pair of huge sunglasses which Lisa captioned: "A pic from our selfie pod... was sooo much fun!!"
description: The Holby City actress gave Instagram a preview of what the night before her wedding was like
